div.sent: All religions have their own religious books.
Christian religion also has a religious book of its own.
The name of the book is the Holy Bible.
The Holy Bible is recited in the religious ceremonies and congregational prayers in the Church.
Sometimes we recite the Holy Bible in our religious classes in our school.
We have the copies of the Holy Bible in our houses as well.
Now we shall try to know something about the Holy Bible.
The Holy Bible is the main religious book of the Christians.
This book contains the messages of God.
After creating the universe, God revealed Himself gradually to man.
Those messages are written in the Holy Bible.
Those who believe in the messages of God and obey them are pious.
After death they go to the heaven.
If we read the Holy Bible, we can learn about God.
At the same time, we can realise His intentions and deeds.
In this way, we gain moral courage to follow the paths of God.
Gradually our faith in Him grows firm.
Thus we can be good and virtuous.
How have we got the Holy Bible?
God created man after his own image.
He had a plan for mankind.
God wanted that man should follow the paths He had shown to him.
He wanted man to avoid things that tempted him to do sinful acts.
He chose a few distinguished persons to convey His wishes and plans to mankind.
Spirited by God those distinguished persons realised the divine words and wrote them down.
This is how we got the Holy Bible.
The Holy Bible is divided mainly into two parts.
God has expressed His love and affection to mankind in various ways.
Little did man know about God before.
He chose the Israelites as His own race.
He gradually revealed Himself to them.
They were once slaves in Egypt.
God freed them from their slavery.
He brought them to an independent country.
He guided them.
Thus man had come to know about God and put faith in Him.
So, the Old Testament is the history of man's faith and his salvation.
It is a long history of how they had been on the path of salvation.
The preaching of his followers and disciples are also written down in this book.
Christian Religious Studies 29 The Holy Bible is not a single book.
It is the compilation of many books.
In the New Testament, there are 27 books.
We shall memorise the names of the books of the New Testament.
We can divide these 27 books of the New Testament into four parts.
First Part (4 books): Gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.
Second Part (1 book) : Lives of the disciples (work of the Messengers).
Thus the disciples made the Christian Churches spread in many other countries.
Third Part (21 books): It contains the letters of the disciples Jesus.
They wrote letters to many devotees in different parts of the world.
These letters are about the teaching of Jesus.
The also show how Jesus encouraged his disciples.
21 books contain those letters.
Fourth Part (1 book): Book of Revelations.
Saint John with his divine vision could see Jesus and the saints.
He wrote all these in this book.
God has gradually revealed Himself to human beings.
It is the history of God's revelation.
This is called the history of salvation.
This history has been written in the Bible.
Gradually God has expressed His love to human beings.
This relationship between human beings and God is very intimate.
So the Holy Bible is a great book for us.
For this we will remain ever grateful to Him.
